page.title: 16WILD AND CULTIVATED PLANTS
page.content: We chose a square which showed a range of land cover and made a survey of roadside wildlife and crops in nearby fields. The land was varied, ranging from cultivated fields to Council owned grass areas near to housing. There was a wide variety of wild plants and flowers, many of them in bloom. They included,{Cow Parsley, {Thistles,Bogweed,Goose Grass,Ivy and {Blackberries.}There were also a number of road side trees including {Oak,Sweetchestnut,Elderberry,Holly,Ash {and Birch.}Much of the farm land was rough pasture and so had{marshy grass, {Clover and Buttercups}whereas the ploughed fields were growing{Wheat, {Barley and Oil Seed Rape}(this is a new crop which has only been grown locally in the past few years. Heavy through traffic has resulted in roadside pollution and debris.
